item.description: Hi! I’m a PhD student in philosophy at Stockholm University. I work on semantics, pragmatics, and the philosophy of language. Much of my work has concerned question semantics, in particular inquisitive semantics. I started as a PhD student in February, 2019. Before this, I obtained a Master’s degree in logic from University of Amsterdam in 2018, and a Bachelor’s degree in philosophy (with a minor in linguistics) from Stockholm University in 2016.

item.title: talks
item.description: Selected. For a complete list of talks, see my CV. 2020 Delusions and other question-sensitive beliefs. Talk at fifth PLM workshop on Delusions in language and mind, University of Amsterdam, October 2020. Factive islands and interrogative logical triviality. Slides Talk at SALT 30, Cornell University (on-line), August 2020. 2019 Sources of meaning-driven unacceptability. Abstract Talk at Principles of Formal Semantics, Stockholm University, September 2019. Inquisitive logical triviality and questions in Yucatec Maya.

item.title: papers
item.description: 2020 Factive islands and interrogative logical triviality. PDF In Semantics and Linguistic Theory 30. The semantics and pragmatics of nouns in concealed questions. PDF Semantics & Pragmatics 13(7). 2019 Sortal versus relational nouns in concealed questions. In Proceedings of Chicago Linguistic Society 54. Inquisitive logical triviality and grammar. PDF MSc thesis, University of Amsterdam.

item.title: teaching
